intro: Impatiens nomenyae, commonly known as the Congo impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, delicate blooms. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
